patient_risk_factors.explanation: Patients with pre-existing cardiac conditions or hypertension have a higher risk of developing cardiac toxicity when treated with Carfilzomib, Dexamethasone, or Bortezomib.
Patients with a history of kidney disease are at higher risk for renal dysfunction when using drugs like Carfilzomib, Cyclophosphamide, or Lenalidomide.
Patients with a history of anemia or bone marrow disorders are more susceptible to severe myelosuppression with Cyclophosphamide, Carfilzomib, or Pomalidomide.
Patients with pre-existing neurological symptoms or peripheral nerve damage are at increased risk for developing or worsening neuropathy with Bortezomib or Pomalidomide.
Patients with a history of thromboembolism, cardiac disease, or prolonged immobilization are at higher risk for thromboembolic events when using Lenalidomide, Pomalidomide, or Dexamethasone.
Patients with a history of recurrent infections or immune deficiency are at higher risk for severe infections when using Daratumumab or Lenalidomide.
